comments:
I am using the I20030306 build on windows NT 4.0 with a Solaris CVS server

I have 6 projects defined within a working set. I am trying to use the
"Synchronize CVS Projects" toolbar action. The CVS select working set dialog
pops up and after choosing my working set it starts doing the synchronize. After
awhile  it pops up an error dialog "Unable to synchronize" with the message
"internal error"

I then tried to isolate which project it was failing on by selecting one project
at a time and doing a synchronize. In this case the sync worked without any
errors  on all the projects. In the specific instance that was tested there was
nothing to synchronize since all the projects were already in sync.

This problem only occurred after upgrading to the I20030306 build.

Attached below is the .log contents

Regards

Sanjay

Did the working set selected contain only projects or were some lower level 
resources selected (i.e. child selected by parent not selected).
The working set had only projects selected and nothing excluded from the children
Does your working set contain a project that is not in your workspace?
No all projects were already loaded and actually were already synchronized.

I have no idea how you got in the state that would cause the error but I have 
found the most likely loop hole in the code and fixed it.

Bug still exists in RC2.
Bug verified fixed in N20030310
